特記事項: 【合併】Global Diversity（総合政策研究科修士）/Seminar in Global Diversity（大学院共通科目・認定科目前期）
授業方法: This seminar will be conducted face to face on campus.

第1回:
(9/26) Introduction to the seminar: Understanding diversity and its critical importance for achieving SDGs (Miwa)
1) Objectives and focuses of the seminar
2) What is diversity in societies and communities?
3) SDGs: What is needed to "leave no one behind"?
4) Who has a risk to be left behind?

Required readings:
1) Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development
https://sdgs.un.org/2030agenda

2) The Sustainable Development Goals Report 2024
https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=the+sustainable+development+goals+report+2024&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8

3) Sustainable Development Report 2024
https://dashboards.sdgindex.org
第2回:
（10/3）Gender as a Critical Concept/Perspective for Understanding Diversity (Miwa)
1) What is gender?: Understanding the concept of gender.
2) Exploring your gender awareness and experiences.

Required readings:
1) Sex and Gender
https://www.coe.int/en/web/gender-matters/sex-and-gender

2) Gender Equality in Academia and Research - GEAR Tool
https://eige.europa.eu/gender-mainstreaming/toolkits/gear/terms-and-definitions?language_content_entity=en
第3回:
（10/10）Global commitment to gender equality and the empowerment of women (Miwa)
1) Understanding historical development and transformation of focus of issues on gender.
2) Understanding priority areas of the work on gender
3) Institutionalisation of gender mainstreaming in the UN

Required readings:
1)  Turning Promises into Action
https://www.unwomen.org/en/digital-library/sdg-report

2)  Planet 50-50 by 2030
http://www.unwomen.org/en/get-involved/step-it-up

3)  HeForShe
http://www.heforshe.org/en

4) Progress on the Sustainable Development Goals: The Gender Snapshot 2024
https://www.unwomen.org/en/resources/gender-snapshot

5) UN Women Guiding Documents
https://www.unwomen.org/en/about-us/guiding-documents
第4回:
（10/17）Privilege and oppression: Opposite sides of the same coin (Deguchi)
1) Privilege: What is it, and how does it work?
2) Understanding structural oppression
3) Theories of racial identity development
4) Becoming allies: Psychological processes of change for dominant group members

Required readings:
1)https://nationalseedproject.org/images/documents/Knapsack_plus_Notes-Peggy_McIntosh.pdf

2) Coates, T. (2014) The Case for Reparations: https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2014/06/the-case-for-reparations/361631/

3) More Than a Knapsack: The White Supremacy Flower as a New Model for Teaching Racism

4) Sue, D. W., & Sue, D. (2019). White racial identity development model (Ch.12). Counseling the culturally diverse: Theory and practice. John Wiley & Sons.

5) Sue, D. W., & Sue, D. (2019). Racial, ethnic, cultural (REC) identity attitudes in people of color (Ch. 11). Counseling the culturally diverse: Theory and practice.
John Wiley & Sons.

6) Townsend, S. S. M., Markus, H. R., & Bergsieker, H. B. (2009). My Choice, Your Categories: The Denial of Multiracial Identities. Journal of Social Issues, 65(1), 185–204.
第5回:
（10/24）Microaggressions (Miwa)
1) Understanding its definition and importance in working for diversity and inclusion
2) Learning from specific cases

Suggested readings:
1) Sue, D. W. (2010) "Microaggressions in Everyday Life: Race, Gender & Sexual Orientation",  John Wiley & Sons.
第6回:
（10/31）Intersectionality from the Perspective of Minority Women (Komori)
1) What is “intersectionality”?: its concept, backgrounds and functions.
2) Intersectional inequality and discrimination in the present world
i) The case of minority women in Japan
ii) The case of Dalit women in South Asia
3) What is needed to effectively address the issue of intersectionality
and to achieve human rights and equality of minority women?
i) What kind of policies are needed?
ii) Important role of civil society organisations

Required readings:
1) Caste based sexual violence and state impunity

2) Caste and Gender Justice/IDSN
https://idsn.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Caste-and-Gender-Justice-Low-Res2.pdf

3) Situations and Challenges of Minority Women in Japan
第8回:
(11/14) Issues of persons with disabilities (Nakanishi)
1) Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD)
2) Social model of disability

Required readings:
1)Factsheet: The Social Model of Disability
https://www.inclusionlondon.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/FactSheets_TheSocialModel.pdf

2) Introduction to the Social and Medical Models of Disability
https://www.ombudsman.org.uk/sites/default/files/FDN-218144_Introduction_to_the_Social_and_Medical_Models_of_Disability.pdf
第9回:
(11/21)  Issues of SOGIESC
1) Global situation of LGBTQI+
2) Advancement and challenges of the rights of LGBTQI+
第10回:
(11/28) Racial Discrimination/BLM (Miwa)
1) What is racism?
2) Racism and issues of decolonisation
3) Strategies for overcoming racism

Suggested readings:
1) Hooks, Bell (2000) "Feminism is for Everybody: Passionate politics" South End Press.
第11回:
(12/5) Gender-responsive planning for mainstreaming gender (1) (Miwa)
1) What is social and gender analysis?
2) Applying the most important tools of social and gender analysis
3) A case from Laos
4) How can we work for gender mainstreaming?
第12回:
(12/12) Gender-responsive planning for mainstreaming gender (2) (Miwa)
1) Lessons from "Entering women's world through men's eyes" 
2) Tools and methods to understand women's contribution in the community
3) Overcoming invisibility of women
4) Nurturing women's empowerment through gender mainstreaming

Required readings:
1) Bilgi, Meena, "Entering women's world through men's eyes" in Guijt, Irene and Meera Kaul Shah, “The Myth of Community: Gender issues in participatory development”, Intermediate Technology Publications Ltd., 1998, pp. 93-99.
第13回:
(12/19) Conclusion and pathways for leaving no one behind (Miwa)
1) Reflection and discussion
2) How can we work as “change agent” and "allies" for a sustainable world where diversity is fully respected.
第14回: (1/9) Presentation and discussion of term paper
